body.p:
Hartford Kenty
Sept 22d 1862
To His Excellency Gov J. F Robinson
Frankfort
Sir
So far as we know, we are the only candidates for Congress in the Second district to fill the vacancy occasioned by Genl Jas S Jacksons resignation.

We propose your writ of election shall fix Tuesday the 21st day of October as the day of election, or if that will not allow twenty days to elapse after the receipt of this, then as soon thereafter as possible --

We have deemed that owing to the disturbed and uncertain condition of
affairs, the election should be ^held^ as soon as possible it can conveniently be done --

Very Respectfully
Your obt Servts
Geo H Yeaman
Edwd R. Weir. Sr.

2nd Congressional District
Issue Writ of election for Octr 29 1862.
J. F. Robinson
Issd Sept 29. 1862
